alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Lee; Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 2:38PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Owsley, western Breathitt and southeastern Lee Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 237 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cowcreek, or near Booneville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Jetts Creek, Houston and Athol around 245 PM EDT. Turkey, Guerrant, Copebranch, Sebastian`s Branch, Talbert and Crockettsville around 250 PM EDT. Chenowee, Canoe and Oakdale around 255 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Curt, Yeadon, Gentry, Howard Creek, Saldee, Copland, War Creek, Little, Whick, Elkatawa, Haddix, Fivemile, Frozen Creek, Lawson, Jackson, Inverness, Dumont, Quicksand, Lost Creek, Flintville, Sewell, Clayhole, Vancleve, Wilhurst, Noctor, Portsmouth, Smith Branch, Wilstacy, Keck and Hardshell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
